Description: Bowl and tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior, from outside: glazed wall; tondo border consisting of three black lines; band of two rows of staggered dots; two black lines; frieze of alternating red and black tongues; exterior: from outside edge; reserved handle zone with black below; black lower wall with resrved band containing four lines; inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, parallels are to be found with University College London UCL 2 and Reading 26.2.94 (Reading CVA I, pl. 23, no. 42; Venit 1982, 374, no. B513). UCL 2 is not assuredly from Naukratis, and the Reading fragment is not from the same cup. Compare Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups III. Amsterdam 2000, pl. 239 a, which are fragments by the C Painter, 570-560 BC. The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as Reading 26.2.94.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 374-5, no. B514)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0399) (Phase 1)
